name: Cha Pa Garden Boutique Hotel & Spa

reviews.title: highly recommened for a boutique hotel
reviews.text: I felt like part of the family that owns and operates this lovely hotel. I visited for 3 days as a side trip from Hanoi . Though I had no prior plan, Tommy and his wife (owners of the hotel) took care of all my varied tour interests every day with no problem. They are fabulously gracious hosts.

About the hotel: The location is great: right in the middle of the main street of Sapa though set a a half-street above it so you get some quiet, some gardens and tranquility. The meals at the hotel were superb and the service was outstanding. The dining room is on the entry level and is centered around a hearth that was fired even tho it was July and it was perfect. Breakfast, included in the price, was wonderful. They serve Vietnamese cafe exactly as it should be, any time of the day.
reviews.title: An Incredible Boutique Experience

likes.disliked: — Guests in the hallway may wake other guests as rooms share a common hallw

reviews.text: There are no shower curtains in the bathroom - no surprise there - but the rooms are are modern, spacious, and offer all usual things you need. Internet access is in the lobby. Ask for the rooms with the balcony for a view of the gardens and the street life.
reviews.title: Gracious Hosts & Excellent Accomodations

likes.liked: — Although their is no internet access, the front desk would let me use their computer to check my email for 15-20 minutes at a time.
likes.disliked: — There is no drain in the bathroom to catch the water that spills from the curtainless shower area, so it puddles.

reviews.text: For the price, location and wonderful service, you cannot do better.
reviews.title: lovely stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This boutique is one of our most unique and pleasant hotel experiences. After living and travelling in the region for 9 years, we give this wonderful hotel a big thumbs up.
reviews.title: Beautiful gem in center of Sapa

reviews.text: without a doubt, our best hotel in vietnam. we stayed 2 nights.
reviews.title: great stay!!!!!

reviews.text: no need to go into too much detail as the previous posts are completely accurate. its just a really great place.
reviews.title: So many reasons to love the Cha Pa Garden!

reviews.text: we also loved the restaurant. my Argentinian beef was amazing.
reviews.title: What a comfy homey place

likes.disliked: — The lack of a shower door

reviews.text: not sure if I saw it any of the other posts, but the free breakfast that came with the stay was superb. I loved the seasonal fruit juice. Must have had 4 cups over our stay.
reviews.title: perfect stay at Cha Pa

likes.liked: — the staff was amazingly helpful and accomodating to all our needs
likes.disliked: — still getting a few things finished -- this is a brand new renovatation of a French villa

reviews.text: Staff was excellent too. They took care of laundry for cheaper than any of the laundromats we saw around town, booked transportation without any hotel fees, and helped arrange a tour that was 1/2 the price quoted from other agencies around the town.
reviews.title: I love love love this place!

likes.liked: — The design of the place, details, cozy, amazing staff

reviews.text: MY TRAVEL STYLE: I hate business hotels and strongly prefer resorts that resemble the Four Seasons, Aman, and Oberoi but try to find similar properties at lower cost. I seek out the “wow” experiences and I encourage you to view hotels I have stayed at and their respective reviews (by clicking on my name).
reviews.title: Best Boutique Hotel in Sapa

reviews.text: Tommy and Chai are wonderful hosts who go all out to make your stay as authentic and memorable as possible. They never seemed to sleep and were always available to give advice on travel arrangments, spa treatments, markets, shopping. They booked us tours and jeep charters that cost up to half less than from outside agents. They did not pocket any commission for themselves.
reviews.title: Best Kept Secret
A Norwegian/Hill-tribe dream being made a reality
reviews.text: They even invited us to a Hmong wedding (chai is hmong), which was an unforgettable experience.
There was a mix-up with train tickets, but Tommy more than made up for it by offering us a free dinner and breakfast. Twin rooms are not ready yet, but he made up a spare bed for us without any fuss.
reviews.title: A fantastic stay with above average service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfasts were great - try the banana pancakes with bacon and sapa honey. Location is unbeatable too. Altogether a most satisfyiing find.....
reviews.title: Clean, stylish bedroom and Amazing Breakfast!!!

likes.liked: — Clean, spacious room; personal service; amazing breakfast!

reviews.text: Tommy and Chai are a married couple who seem set on building their dream hotel perched in the middle of Sapa. They are both lovely, open and generous hosts, and their taste in decoration and set-up makes the place feel very "koselig" (Norwegian for Cosy).
reviews.title: Great Experience! Fantastic Host

aka: Cha Pa Garden Boutique Hotel And Spa
description: Cha Pa Garden Boutique Hotel & Spa is the first hotel of its kind in the town of Sapa and provides a breathing space only 50 m from the busy market. Guests are welcomed to comfortable rooms and friendly service in this beautifully renovated French villa.The restaurant is making great both local and western dishes, and our green garden is unique in center town.
